_comment: Created by NCODowd on 24/05/2016 16:32:01 using v2.7
title: How does carer quality of life vary by age group?
analysis_commentary: Nationally, carers over the age of 65 reported higher quality of life scores (8.1) than those aged 18-64 (7.6). The extent to which this differs varied across the country. In Yorkshire and the Humber, there was a 0.2 point difference, by in the East Midlands there was a 0.7 point difference in score.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Adult Social Care Outcomes Framework
